The EL spectra of (PEA) 2(FA) 2Pb 3Br 10‐based LEDs under different operating voltages are shown in Figure 9e. Different from the PL peak, there is only one single green EL peak located at 532 nm, while the blue light peak is not observed. The reason for this phenomenon is that the driving force for PL is the energy difference only, while the driving force of EL is the combination of energy difference and applied electric field, so most charges are injected into the smallest bandgap region and then recombine.
